intro: Ribes malvifolium, commonly known as the woolly currant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically red or purple in color, similar to other currants. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shady habitats. The botanical features of Ribes malvifolium make it a valuable plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
